rationales.achievement: He was short with his mother during a supplier meeting, then lost productive work time driving to two pharmacies and sitting in the car, unable to perform at his professional standard.
rationales.benevolence: Despite his frustration, he drove to two pharmacies after the meeting to find his mother's specific blood pressure pills and left them outside her door when she wouldn't come out.

rationales.self_direction: He spent four hours creating a color-coded medication schedule when quarterly reports were due, his own work priorities surrendered to caregiving demands.
rationales.achievement: Lifen pointed out he spent four hours on the pill organizer when quarterly reports were due, and he acknowledges the math doesn't work -- everyone needs a piece of him and nothing is left.
rationales.benevolence: He built a detailed color-coded medication schedule with large-font labels for his mother, persisting despite her insistence she could remember on her own.

rationales.achievement: He defended his career to friends by citing business expansion into Southeast Asian markets, asserting he's growing and succeeding despite looking tired.
rationales.security: He enumerates the financial obligations -- tutoring fees, specialist appointments, Hong Kong rent -- as justification for maintaining his current work intensity, choosing stability for his family.
rationales.conformity: He chose each obligation deliberately -- taking in his mother, sending Yuxin to Hong Kong -- and frames them as what he 'should be doing,' meeting family expectations without complaint.
rationales.benevolence: He took his mother in without hesitation when his father died and insisted Yuxin go to Hong Kong for her career despite the cost, putting family needs above his own comfort.
He sat at the dining table for an hour quizzing Haojie on chemistry while his mother peeled fruit for them -- a quiet family moment where he was simply present for his son.

rationales.self_direction: He recognized he 'chose convenient over present' by texting 'OK' instead of calling when his mother had a dizzy spell, unable to break away from the client obligation.
rationales.achievement: He stayed at KTV with Mr. Tanaka until 1am because the deal would cover Yuxin's next semester -- prioritizing the business outcome over being home.
rationales.conformity: He went along with Tanaka's KTV invitation because it's 'good business practice to build the relationship,' following the expected social protocol of client entertainment.
rationales.benevolence: His mother had a dizzy spell and Lifen handled it alone while he replied with a two-word text between karaoke songs, choosing career advancement over being present for his family.

rationales.achievement: Tanaka confirmed the contract, validating his decision to stay out -- 'at least the evening wasn't wasted' frames the outcome in terms of professional success.
rationales.benevolence: Lifen has been quieter than usual and he suspects she's keeping a tally of the nights he chooses work over home, recognizing the cost to his closest relationship.

rationales.self_direction: He told Yuxin she should talk to her teammates and set expectations rather than absorb everything, then recognized he heard himself in her -- a moment of independent self-reflection.
rationales.benevolence: He had a forty-minute call with Yuxin, gave her advice he struggles to follow himself, and reflected on how the family bonds -- his daughter calling, his wife's shoulder squeeze -- are what he'd 'burn everything down to keep.'

rationales.achievement: He skipped Haojie's parent-teacher meeting because a shipment got held at customs, prioritizing business operations over his promise to attend.
rationales.benevolence: He broke his promise to Haojie to attend the meeting, and his son's silent withdrawal -- not asking to be quizzed tonight -- signals the cost to their relationship.
He took Haojie for beef noodles after school as a quiet gesture of repair, showing up for his son the day after missing the meeting.

rationales.tradition: The entire family independently mobilized for Ma's birthday -- Yuxin flying in, ordering the specific bakery cake, Lifen getting fish from the wet market at 6am -- honoring the matriarch as a family ritual.
rationales.benevolence: Each family member moved toward the same thing separately without coordination because they all know it matters; Weimin reflects this is what he's been building -- a family that shows up for each other.

rationales.tradition: He'll drive Ma to visit Auntie Fang on Saturday because Ma will worry about her lonely friend all week otherwise -- maintaining the web of family and community obligation.
rationales.benevolence: He chooses to drive his mother to visit Auntie Fang not out of obligation but because his mother's worry about her friend would become his worry -- an interconnected chain of care.
